text: Hi everyone! Hope someone can help :pray::blush: I need to hide/show a field from a HubSpot form based on an action. This form is embedded in a Wordpress page. Can I do this from HubSpot or within the embedding script or should I work this under Wordpress? Any suggestion can be useful, this is a new one for me, thaanks a lot in advance!

You can use: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/use-progressive-fields-in-forms> if you have the right subscription. If not you can try to create it by your self with javascript: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>
yes! in this particular case, progressive fields won't do it for me, but then to insert javascript, i can do it through the embed script?

Then you should use the form submission API instead. What you can try if you really want to use an embed script is: use the _onFormReady_ (fires when the form is rendered) function to add fields based on the value of an other input. But yeah the best way is to make a form in Wordpress with the logic and send the data with the form submission api.
